title: Tjaetsieålmaj
text: Tjaetsieålmaj or Thjathjeolmai (the <a href="man">man</a> of the <a href="water">water</a>) controlled <a href="lake">lake</a>s and <a href="river">river</a>s, and gave <a href="fishing">fishing</a> <a href="Luck">fortune</a> to <a href="people">people</a> in <a href="Sami%20shamanism">Sami mythology</a>. The word Thjathje means water, and is said to be the <a href="etymology">origin</a> of the <a href="name">name</a> of the Norse <a href="j%C3%B6tunn">jötunn</a> Tjatsi.
